From: "Jason @ ML Mastery" <jason@MachineLearningMastery.com>
Subject: Deep learning library everyone should use

Hi, top deep learning libraries in Python are TensorFlow and
Theano.

They are powerful libraries, but there is one critical problem
with both of them.

They were designed by academics and engineers for academics and
engineers. Not for practitioners like you and me. This means they
are really complicated and a real pain to use. Like tens or
hundreds of lines of code for simple networks.

There is a much better option. It is called Keras and it wraps
both Theano and TensorFlow, giving you all the power of both, in
just a few lines of code.

Deep learning is fun with Keras, a heck of a lot of fun! I
strongly recommend it when just starting out.

Learn more about the Keras library for deep learning in Python in
the post:
